page.title: 10Shouldham-Where we live.
page.content: Many of the older buildings contain stone from the Gilbertine Abbey. These can be seen towards the base of some houses on the Green. Local flint, carrstone and locally made bricks are much in evidence and many roofs are slate. Quite a proportion of older houses have rendered exteriors. One of the oldest houses is Colt's Hall and was mentioned in the first Domesday book. The houses on the Green are a mixture of cottages and conversions. One was a public house, and behind the shop is a caravan site with some 19 residential caravans.
